Inspiring a New Generation of Leaders:

Dr. Maria Klawe

Dr. Maria Klawe is an inspirational and tireless education advocate who was instrumental in the creation of EdReports. She is a renowned computer scientist and scholar who began her tenure as the first female president of Harvey Mudd College in 2006. After recognizing the value that information about high-quality materials could have for the education field, she led a team to design and ultimately launch EdReports.org. She has served as EdReports board chair since 2014. Dr. Klawe has devoted her life to improving K-12 science and mathematics education and removing gender and racial disparity in these fields. She has been nationally recognized for her commitment and success in diversifying Harvey Mudds student population, where half of the population at this elite science and engineering school are female and half represent diverse racial backgrounds. Dr. Klawe is also a frequent contributor to Forbes where you can find a broad array of her commentary on education and equity.

Why We Care

At EdReports, we know materials matter for kids. Our mission is to increase the capacity of teachers, administrators, and leaders to seek, identify, and demand high-quality instructional materials to ensure students at all levels receive an excellent education.

Student Learning

Rigorous college and career-ready standards can improve and deepen student learning. What is taught matters.

High Expectations for All

Not all students have the same access to rigorous curriculum materials and this perpetuates the opportunity gap.

Equity

For education to be truly excellent and equitable, high-quality curriculum and instructional materials must be available and implemented for all students.
